stories.text:
Extract from Citizen News Journal

It's been weeks now since lions have been sighted in the city and the population is getting more and more afraid. Yet, one citizen have raised a voice in defence. 

Local college student Trish Grady have been writing letters to every newspapers and news stations claiming that we should protect, not kill, the lions roaming in the local park.

"I've been studying them for the past 2 months. They have shown no signs of aggressiveness at all. They feed entirely on cabbages. I can assure you that there is absolutely no reason to be afraid."

Based on these claims, local zoo have sent field experts to investigate the situation. 

In a press conference today, the experts announced the beginning of a new field research. "For now, we ask for people to stay away from them and leave them be until the investigation is concluded", said the lead expert. "We are working with the autorities to make sure nobody, including the animals, gets hurt."

In the meantime, Ms Grady will continue to work with the zoo scientists and share her field research results. "It's a lot more fun science project than just building another of those potato clock!"
